As previous writers have indicated the analysis by Larson is flawed.

The article states "...R0 is the average number of Ph.D.s that a
tenure-track professor will graduate over the course of his or her
career, with an R0 of one meaning each professor is replaced by one
new Ph.D." However the professor in a PhD granting research university
is producing not only the replacement for the research university
professor but is also producing replacements for the PhDs in the many
non-research colleges and universities that do not have PhD programs
and so do not produce any PhDs. Thus an R0 much greater than one
is needed for a steady state.
